meanings.definition: A sound expressing surprise, pleasure, or relief.
meanings.sent1: The audience let out aahs when the magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent2: The children's aahs filled the room when they saw the colorful balloons.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful aahs always brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with a palette of aahs and wows.
meanings.sent5: The aahs of joy echoed through the park as the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'aah', used to express the same emotions.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with aahs as the children opened their presents.
meanings.sent2: The aahs of the crowd could be heard as the singer hit a high note.
meanings.sent3: The aahs of the audience turned into laughter when the clown tripped on stage.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a symphony of aahs as visitors admired the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The aahs of the group signaled their approval of the delicious cake.
